answer_html: \(\exists x \in \mathbb{R}\ \textrm{s.t.}\ \forall y \in \mathbb{N}\ x^2 +y \geq x + y^2.\)
hints_html: Remember that the negation of the statement “For all \(x\), \(P(x)\) is true.” is “There exist an \(x\) such that \(P(x)\) is false”.
hints_latex:
Remember that the negation of the statement ``For all $x$, $P(x)$ is
true.'' is ``There exist an $x$ such that $P(x)$ is false''.
hints_raw: Remember that the negation of the statement "For all <math>x</math>, <math>P(x)</math> is true." is "There exist an <math> x </math> such that <math>P(x)</math> is false".
question: 1 (d)
sols_html:
The negation of the statement is given by

\[\begin{aligned} \exists x \in \mathbb{R}\ \textrm{s.t.}\ \forall y \in \mathbb{N}\ x^2 +y \geq x + y^2.\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The negation of the statement is given by

:<math>\exists x \in \mathbb{R}\ \textrm{s.t.}\ \forall y \in \mathbb{N}\ x^2 +y \geq x + y^2.</math>
statement_html:
Write the negation of the statement

\(\forall ~x \in \mathbb{R}, \exists ~y \in \mathbb{N} {\rm~s.t.~} x^{2} + y < x + y^{2}\).
statement_latex:
Write the negation of the statement

$\forall ~x \in \mathbb{R}, \exists ~y \in \mathbb{N} {\rm~s.t.~} x^{2} + y < x + y^{2}$.
statement_raw:
Write the negation of the statement

<math>\forall ~x \in \mathbb{R}, \exists ~y \in \mathbb{N} {\rm~s.t.~} x^{2} + y < x + y^{2}</math>.
